newsitem.title: USA: Dow Jones sees big growth in online journal.
newsitem.headline: Dow Jones sees big growth in online journal.

text.p: Dow Jones & Co Chief Executive Peter Kann said Wednesday he expects paid subscriptions to the interactive edition of the Wall Street Journal to more than double in a year from the current 50,000 paid subscriptions.
Kann told reporters after a presentation at the PaineWebber Media Conference that he believes that subscriptions would more than double and rise "hopefully above that" by the end of 1997.
In addition to the 50,000 paid subscriptions sold by Dow Jones there are currently another 150,000 customers using the service through an introductory program offer by Microsoft Corp.
Kann said he estimated that the company could convert about one-third of those subscriptions to Dow Jones paid subscriptions.
Most of the Microsoft introductory subscriptions expire in the first quarter of 1997.
